Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class Mesh

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.EntityData
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Mesh
Direct Known Subclasses:
Mesh2, Mesh3
public abstract class Mesh extends EntityData
An abstract parent for mesh objects.

    • SORT_3

      protected static final Comparator<Vec3> SORT_3

    • faces

      public int[][][] faces
      The faces array does not include face data itself, but rather indices to other arrays which contain vertex data. It is a three-dimensional array organized by
      1. the number of faces;
      2. the number of vertices per face;
      3. the information per vertex;

      The innermost array, information per face, may vary with each mesh; 3D meshes, for example, include normals while 2D meshes don't.

    • materialIndex

      public int materialIndex
      The material associated with this mesh in a mesh entity.

  • Method Details

    • auditFaceType

      public static Map<Integer,Integer> auditFaceType(Mesh m)
      Counts the occurrence of faces with a given number of vertices. Useful for determining whether a face is composed entirely of triangles, quadrilaterals, or is non-uniform.

      Returns a Map, where the vertex count is the key and the tally are the value.

      The audit places 3 and 4 into the map, even if the mesh contains neither triangles nor quadrilaterals, because they are common entries to query. When querying other possibilities, check whether the map contains a key prior to using its get method.
      Parameters:
      m - the mesh
      Returns:
      the audit

    • edgesPermute

      public static boolean edgesPermute(int[][] a, int aIdx, int[][] b, int bIdx)
      Evaluates whether two edges are permutations of each other. This is based on whether they refer to the same coordinates, but do so in a different sequence.

      Because edge indices are assumed to be positive integers, a sum and product algorithm is used.
      Parameters:
      a - the left comparisand
      aIdx - the edge index
      b - the right comparisand
      bIdx - the edge index
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • facesPermute

      public static boolean facesPermute(int[][] a, int[][] b)
      Evaluates whether two faces are permutations of each other. This is based on whether they refer to the same coordinates, but do so in a different sequence.

      Because face indices are assumed to be positive integers, a sum and product algorithm is used.
      Parameters:
      a - the left comparisand
      b - the right comparisand
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • splice

      public static int[][] splice(int[][] arr, int index, int deletions, int[][] insert)
      Splices a 2D array of integers into the midst of another and returns a new array containing the splice. Does not mutate arrays in place. If the number of deletions exceeds the length of the target array, then a copy of the insert array is returned.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      index - the insertion point
      deletions - deletion count
      insert - the insert
      Returns:
      a new, spliced array
      See Also:
      • System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

    • splice

      public static int[][][] splice(int[][][] arr, int index, int deletions, int[][][] insert)
      Splices a 3D array of integers into the midst of another and returns a new array containing the splice. Does not mutate arrays in place. If the number of deletions exceeds the length of the target array, then a copy of the insert array is returned.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      index - the insertion point
      deletions - deletion count
      insert - the insert
      Returns:
      the spliced array
      See Also:
      • System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

    • cycleFaces

      public Mesh cycleFaces(int places)
      Cycles the array of indices in the faces array by a number of places. The number of places can be positive or negative, indicating which direction to shift the array: positive numbers shift to the right; negative, to the left.
      Parameters:
      places - number of places
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • cycleVerts

      public Mesh cycleVerts(int faceIndex, int places)
      Cycles the array of indices in a face which indicate vertex (and therefore edge) order by a number of places. The number of places can be positive or negative, indicating which direction to shift the array: positive numbers shift to the right; negative, to the left.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      places - number of places
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • reverseFace

      public Mesh reverseFace(int i)
      Flips the indices which specify a face. Changes the winding of a face from counter-clockwise (CCW) to clockwise (CW) or vice versa.
      Parameters:
      i - face index
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • reverseFaces

      public Mesh reverseFaces()
      Flips the indices which specify all faces. Changes the winding from counter-clockwise (CCW) to clockwise (CW) or vice versa.
      Returns:
      this mesh

    • sectionFace

      public boolean sectionFace(int faceIndex, int origIndex, int destIndex)
      Splits a face into two halves according to an origin and destination vertex. The face must have at least 3 vertices. The destination index should not equal the origin index or either of its neighbors. Returns a boolean whether the method was successful.
      Parameters:
      faceIndex - the face index
      origIndex - the origin index
      destIndex - the destination index
      Returns:
      operation success

      public Mesh triangulate()
      Triangulates all faces in a mesh by drawing diagonals from the face's first vertex to all non-adjacent vertices.

      this mesh
